Posts.Content: Hi It was a bit strange, you had to do silly laughs, sit on whoopee cushions and stuff in what was then a room full of strangers but it broke the ice, the chap who did it also suggested we make a "happy box" , after now having had the full round of treatment 6 x TAC and 15 rads im starting to pick up the pieces so have been collecting things that give me happy memories eg i have some brill flyers from my first hol away to Ibiza last week, wrisbands into the clubs and stuff, im looking forward to going to TK maxx to purchase a funky box, any excuse really as i seem to have a thing for boxes anyway :) x x x x x x
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed july last year at 33 years old, i was grade 3 triple neg, i recently went to a breast cancer care young womens forum and it was marvellous, we met with experts from gynaecologists, doctor, healthy eating, menopause, fertility, laughter yoga, i would recommend it to you all, its all free you just need to get yourself there.  And i met some really  fantastic ladies ranging from 30 to 50. I live in stoke and would be interested in joining your group vicki i too found it a bit isolating being younger too and its is hard when folk go oh but your so young and look at you as if you know why big hugs to your all Sarah xx
Posts.Title: To young for breast cancer????
